attributes.action: Give England, 'Hastings Day' the 14th of October, as a Bank Holiday.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
October 14 was the day in 1066 when England's King Harold lost the Battle of Hastings.  
William Duke of Normandy, who was using Hastings as his premier port, then claimed the crown and changed the way England was governed forever.
In 1966 the 900th anniversary was celebrated and it was such a success that Hastings Borough Council decided to celebrate the 14th of October each year as 'HASTINGS DAY'
This day is of huge importance to the indigenous English and England.
All those Anglo-Saxon lives put on the line and lost in order to protect England and its people from Norman invasion and rule, should be celebrated and commemorated in the form of a bank Holiday on October the 14th 'Hastings day'
